author: Cavagnaro

back: A set of vectors is linearly independent if the vector equation x1v1 + x2v2 + … + xnvn = 0 has only the trivial solution x1 = x2 = … = xn = 0
author: Cavagnaro

back: A set of vectors is linearly dependent if the vector equation x1v1 + x2v2 + … + xnvn = 0 has more than one trivial solution
author: Cavagnaro

back: Dimension of the eigenspace associated with one eigenvalue

back: Vectors v1, v2, …, vk (same dimension); coefficients c1, c2, …, vk; c1v1 + c2v2 + … + ckvk is a linear combination
author: Cavagnaro

back: The column space of C (C is a matrix a x b) is the sub space of R^a spanned by the columns C
author: Cavagnaro

back: The null space of C (C is a matrix a x b) is the sub space of R^b consisting of all solutions of the homogeneous equation C(x)=0
author: Cavagnaro

back: Span(v1,…,vk) = all possible linear combinations
author: Cavagnaro

back: A linear system that has at least one solution is called consistent. Otherwise, it is inconsistent.
author: Hehn

back: (1) Swap the positions of two equations; (2) Multiply an equation by a nonzero constant; (3) Add a multiple of one equation to another equation.
author: Hehn

back: A matrix is in RRE form (reduced row-echelon form) if it meets all of these requirements: (1) Any rows of all zeros appear below all nonzero rows; (2) The leading nonzero of any row is a one; (3) Every leading 1 that is lower than another leading 1 is also to the right of it; (3) Every leading 1 is the only nonzero in its column.
author: Hehn

back: The columns of a matrix in RRE form that have leading ones.
author: Hehn

back: The columns of a matrix in RRE form that do not have leading ones.
author: Hehn

back: The steady state x̂ is asymptotically stable if there is a positive number 𝛿 such that the limit as t approaches infinity of x(t, X) = x̂ whenever |X - x̂| < 𝛿 .
author: Hehn

back: The steady state x̂ is said to be stable if, for any 𝜖 > 0, you can ensure that |x(t, X) - x̂| < 𝜖 for all time whenever |X - x̂| < 𝛿, where 𝛿 depends on 𝜖. If there is no such way to choose 𝛿, then x̂ is unstable.
author: Hehn

back: If f '(x̂) < 0, then x̂ is asymptotically stable. If f '(x̂) > 0, then x̂ is unstable. f '(x̂) = 0 is ambiguous, so another analysis is needed in order to determine its stability.
author: Hehn
